facts.fact: The School District of Philadelphia serves over 200,000 students in 339 schools and is the 8th largest in the nation.
The School District of Philadelphia’s annual budget is 3 billion dollars.
As of the 2014–2015 school year, there were 107 languages other than English spoken at home by district students.

properties.name: Philadelphia Police Department

facts.fact: The Philadelphia Police Department is the fourth largest in the nation.
The department proposed an annual budget of $270 million for the 2022 year.
The department employs more than 6,300 sworn members and 800 civilian personnel.

properties.question: A transfer of power through an unlikely transformation of performer.

properties.name: Penn Medicine

facts.fact: The University of Pennsylvania was the nation’s first hospital, founded in 1751, and the first medical school in the US opening in 1765.
The hospital of the University of Pennsylvania is the #1 ranked hospital in the US.
In Philadelphia, nearly 40 percent of non-citizen immigrants are uninsured — over four times the rate of the general population.

properties.question: The medical laboratory as a metabolic theater of the body.

properties.name: City Hall

facts.fact: City Hall was the tallest habitable building in the world from 1894 to 1908.

The building structure used over 88 million bricks and thousands of tons of marble and granite. With almost 700 rooms, City Hall is the largest municipal building in the United States and one of the largest in the world.

The building houses three branches of government: the city's executive branch (Mayor’s Office), its legislature (Philadelphia City Council), and a substantial portion of the judicial activity in the city.

properties.question: Who speaks for whom, who performs for whom?

properties.name: University of The Sciences in Philadelphia

facts.fact: Every year this corridor hosts a $1 Baltimore Avenue Stroll. It showcases local businesses with $1 bargains.
The Baltimore Avenue Business Association serves 137 local businesses in the area.
Clark Park along this walk houses Dickens and Little Nell sculpture, which depicts the author and his character Nell Trent of the novel The Old Curiosity Shop.

Independence National Park houses 19 different historic sites.
Washington Square Park was established by William Penn as one of five green spaces in the city.
Washington Square Park, named in 1825 is home to 60 species of trees, including Philadelphia's only Moon Tree.

The sculptures on city hall were designed by Alexander Milne Calder, the father of the sculptor of the fountain on Logan Circle and the grandfather of the mobile in the lobby of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, called the Ghost, making this walk 'the father, son and (holy) ghost.'
There are 31 sculptures by 31 artists along the Ben Franklin Parkway.
French architect Paul Philippe Cret and the French landscape architect and planner, Jacques Gréber, modeled the Parkway after the Champs-Élysées in Paris.

properties.name: Cherry Street Pier

facts.fact: Cherry Street Peer was originally built as a shipping peer in 1919.
The 5.5 mile Delaware River Trail project connects to the Cherry Street Peer.
Cherry Street Peer houses close to a dozen artist studios in addition to an outdoor restaurant and bar and open performance venue.

properties.question: A transparent space open to all, a framework on the water.
properties.statement: The first public home of the Public Orchestra of Philadelphia.
